website_summaries.verdict: Designed by a squat aficionado, this pad helps some exceed their personal best without vertebral pain.
pros: Molded thick foam design with varying degrees of open and closed cell foam
Grooved  channel in center for neck and cradling the spine
Measures  18 inches long, 3.5 inches in diameter, and 1.25 inches thick
Good for squats and hip thrusts
cons: Can slip on and off the bar
May work better with smaller bars than with Olympic bars

customer_reviews.title: Many uses for it besides squats
customer_reviews.text: I love the squat sponge but I do not use it for Squats (nothing wrong with using a pad for squats, just felt better for me to not use it for squats.) I use it for Hip thrusts, glute bridges, seated calf raises on the smith machine and grip holds. It is an excellent piece of equipment and highly recommended. I do a lot of Bret Contreras stuff in my workouts so it helps. I used 365lbs for Hip thrusts and it felt comfortable. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pat Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Such a worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because all pads at every gym I've been to have been too thin and too used-looking. This pad rocks, plain & simple. I bought it in red so it'd stand out and clearly be something I brought with me, instead of attempting to steal equipment from the gym. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Fanduzzi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Price, Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Bad neck, I use it for squats. Wife uses it for hip thrusts. We both appreciate the cushion. Only downfall is that it slips off unless you watch it, tape it or use Velcro straps at the ends on an Olympic bar.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Wish Dish

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works just as anyone would expect. Very comfortable and the groove down the middle of the sponge allows for the bar to sit perfectly on your shoulders without putting any pressure on the upper vertebrae near the shoulders. I keep the sponge on the bar regardless of the workout I'm doing. It's thin enough that it does not conflict while doing workouts like bench pressing or dead lifts, etc. In fact it also keeps your workout clothes from getting all frizzy and pulled by the texture of the bar, if you care about that kind of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander G.

customer_reviews.title: As a skinny boney guy this makes squats possible again ...
customer_reviews.text: As a skinny boney guy this makes squats possible again. I cant deal with bars on my shoulder/lower neck. Also having broken my collar bone once the weight/pressure becomes a bit much. Even with this though, there are still times where I can feel the bar and the pain sets in, thats just the point of needing to push through tho. Dont force yourself to endure unneeded pains when working out, thats not required for getting in shape. Biggest issue I have with this is the price, this is honestly a foam tube cut and shaved.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great product that will help your neck and back.
customer_reviews.text: This help prevent the neck/shoulder pain I would get when doing squats without it. I would also get red scratches on my shoulders from the bar, but this sponges prevents that. I has lasted for several months with 250+ pounds 3 times a week. The cut quality is decent. It will probably eventually start to fall apart, but even if it only last a year and a half, it will be worth it. I would be It again and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Vance R.

customer_reviews.title: So much better on my neck!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice big thick sponge that protects your neck/shoulders when you do squats/stand calf raises/etc. I'd like it to fit all the way around the bar better as it leaves a small V opening which I put 180 degrees away from my body when using it, but I know it's there and it bugs me. Other than that it is great. Did I mention it is thick? Really thick. Like move my supports up a space to accommodate the different height of the bar with the pad on. But it is well worth the price! I also like using it for good mornings and bar bell lunges.
customer_reviews.author: John T. McClanaghan

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING.  Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Squats are my favorite exercise and this squat sponge makes them completely painless and the weight is felt only where intended....the legs. For women, squats can take a toll on the back/spine, since our traps are much smaller and provide little cushion. This pad is quite large and a bit expensive, but does a fantastic job, much better than the thin, flimsy black ones found in gyms. It has a great grip on the bar and does not slip around. There is no Velcro that can snag the hair either. I'm very happy with this and will be recommending to friends.
customer_reviews.author: K.Itani

customer_reviews.title: pad helps a lot.
customer_reviews.text: This squat pad fits the bar well and protects my neck and shoulders when squatting. I am still build my traps to take the load of the bar so this works until I can handle the squat weights without it. Currently I do not do squats without it on the bar and it allows me to focus on the squat exercise instead of the discomfort on my neck and shoulders during the reps. Simple to us and it holding up to my two times a week for squats. I have wiped it down with a damp towel to keep it clean and smell free.
customer_reviews.author: dmhjr

customer_reviews.title: Old guy....low weight, high reps....
customer_reviews.text: At sixty my best lifting days are behind me. Since I do low weight, high reps I thought that I could address this product from a different viewpoint. I have back problems that make the pressure of a bar on my neck very unpleasant.I mostly do Les Mills Body Pump and Flex which involve low weight but up to 150 reps with no stoppage.I found this product to be very helpful for the squat and lunge portions. It did not impede my grip for other portions of the class. I can't speak to how it would holdup to heavy weights but it out performs the one thickness pad that I had tried before.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rodger

customer_reviews.title: Print is Upside Down
customer_reviews.text: This works fine if you plan to do squats where the bar sits behind your neck. In that regards it is very comfortable. It doesn't work well if you want to roll the bar back to your shoulder blades to be able to perform low crouching squats which takes the pressure off your lower back. Since the sponge doesn't come fully around it can pop up as it rolls. I'm going to replace this product with something that closes around the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Tweezer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but very effective
customer_reviews.text: I never used any pads for years because all other pads eventually compress become flat sided, move around and just distract me. Not fun with a lot of weight on your back. Then our gym got this. Tried it out and works really well you're able to concentrate on your lift instead of worrying about a piece of foam rolling around on your back. It doesn't crush or move and prevents injury to your upper back. I got one for my gym bag as I like to travel and these are generally not around.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: Super.
customer_reviews.text: Love the squat sponge! I am a smaller person and the Olympic bar generally leaves my spine, hip or shoulder blade area sore and/or bruised the day after my workout, but with the squat sponge that does not happen. It's slightly larger than the regular one which i like as well. Bringing my own to the gym is also MUCH cleaner than using theirs! Since I'm more comfortable I can focus more on my form now. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Too bad when happened in squat with heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this foolish produced thing. It is slipping and turning to the blank part of the sponge. Too bad when happened in squat with heavy weight!
customer_reviews.author: Alihan

customer_reviews.title: It flips over and opens up, weight comes out
customer_reviews.text: It falls off too easy. I tie rubber bands around it but then it still flips over and the opening ends up on my C7 area of my back. It is much safer not to put any weight behind your head, I just found out from my chiro. You can really mess up your spine. It's best to do squats while holding the weight in front or if you are into heavy squatting, you should invest in a shoulder harness that lets the weight distribute evenly, not just on your spine and neck.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodMom

customer_reviews.title: It is a cushy pad, I'll give it that ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a cushy pad, I'll give it that. I tried using it for heavy back squats, and it was extremely difficult to get the bar to remain on my shoulders, it rolled off dangerously several times. I tried also using it for heavy hip thrusts, and found it wasn't nearly as effective as the super-thick blue rectangular pads some gyms have.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew David Burt

customer_reviews.title: everybody should get one!!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I get this sooner? Love it, so comfortable when using for squats and smith machines. I no longer have to share the nasty sweaty one with others at the gym. I also able to add more weights on bc I'm not occupy with focusing on the pain. So my squats and lunges with the smith machines ate so much more effective now. Definitely recommend it to everybody. I bought it in red. Love love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. TRAN

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with heavy glute bridges and hip thrusts. It is perfect. Unlike the pads that have a Velcro fastener, this one doesn't snag my clothes or pop open. After several uses the Velcro type ones won't stay closed. This pad grips the bar and doesn't require the Velcro. Most importantly, it has enough padding that I can go extremely heavy and the barbell is not painful on my hips.
customer_reviews.author: EcoBlueLife

customer_reviews.title: Your neck, shoulders and back will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: The pads at my gym always gross me out as they are old and stinky so I decided to splurge for my own. This thing is awesome and way better than I imagined. The little indent for your neck is pure genius and makes doing squats much more tolerable for me. One thing that I love is that this pad doesn't roll on me like the ones with the velcro tend to do. Not to mention, it fits right in my gym bag. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Britni S.

customer_reviews.title: This seemed great at first
customer_reviews.text: This seemed great at first, but my husband and I both experienced neck pain within a few days after using this. It seemed to offer support and protection but my husband ended up having to go to the doctor to get a muscle relaxer! It is pretty thick and forces your head forward. I tried to return this, but apparently missed the deadline by a few weeks. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut_22

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Foam is sturdy and strong, giving extra cushion from the bar eating into your skin. The cutout for your neck is clutch... provides a much more comfortable fit than other products and helps to evenly distribute the weight across your back and shoulders. I loved it from the first moment I used it. Definitely makes doing exercises such as squats, lunges, barbell thrusts, etc. a way more pleasurable experience, allows you to be comfortable and focus on doing your exercise correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I invested in.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this Squat Sponge for anybody who has a weak upper back/shoulder and does squats quite often. I play competitive beach volleyball so I usually train at the gym doing squats all day long. This product has made it easier on my shoulder and back especially when you are squating well over 200 pounds. Do your shoulder and upper back a favor, and buy this sponge. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it but unless you have neck issues
customer_reviews.text: As someone who lifts (lighter) weights and also has a neck problem, this really helps relieve the pressure on my back. I saw someone else who had one with a similar issue. Four stars because it was kind of expensive for what it is, so it took a while to actually decide to buy it. Like it but unless you have neck issues, too, it might be a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: I love this for glute bridges and hip thrusts only
customer_reviews.text: I love this for glute bridges and hip thrusts only...which is why I bought it. If you ever tried lifting heavy weight on your pelvis you know it can be very painful- the squat sponge makes it very comfortable to lift the heaviest of weight. I tried to use it for squats and I am not a fan- it is too bulky for my liking. But that is not a big deal since I can squat without a pad. I like that it is a bright color and not just black which can make it "walk off"easily at the gym- this happened with my Hampton pad. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: NY2FL

customer_reviews.title: The best barbell pad!
customer_reviews.text: I have been pumping iron for years, but never heard of the Squat Sponge. One day, while on vacation in Socal, I entered the local gym to start my leg day. I proceeded over to the squat rack, where I found this unusual looking bright red pad labeled "Squat Sponge". I put it on the bar and proceeded to warm up. By my 4th set, with a hefty 315lbs on my upper back, I fell in love. It was a truly magical feeling. Looking down at my pumped, rippling quads, I vowed never to squat without the Squat Sponge again. This barbell pad has forever changed my life.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: Most times the deturant to doing squats is nhow uncomfortable it is with that much weight on your neck and shoulders, this pad takes all that pain away and because of the contour it sits right where it should be, my only complaint is it would be nice if it had some type of elastic sleave to keep it together better. If it rotates around while lifting it off, it could drop the bar between the pads opening and its right where you don't want it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: My gym has no pads, and this fits the Olympic bar and the bar on the Smith machine as well. Just got it so I can't comment on its durability.
customer_reviews.author: L8start

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly functional
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment is stylish and completely functional. It cushions the neck for heavy duty squats. My wife uses this as well. It's snazzy color matches my equipment. This is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Works!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!! Saves that bony spot at thrip of your spine where the bar irritates and causes you to not completely focus. So good that my husband who squats really really heavy weight borrowed mine and never returned it. Guess I will be purchasing another one, happily because it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kasha

customer_reviews.title: Squat Sponge
customer_reviews.text: Very cooshy! Can't even feel the heavy weight on your shoulders. The groove in the center of the pad may not be ideal for larger necked people. It can cause the neck to push forward, slightly out of alignment. Other than that, the feedback from the gym has all been positive. Durability seems good but it has only been out in the racks for four weeks. Does not slide and is easy to clean. It's obviously a few bucks more than the others but seems well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shawcroft

customer_reviews.title: Use it for Barbell Glute Bridges
customer_reviews.text: I have done loaded barbell glute bridges in the past, but have been limited by the discomfort of the bar biting into my pelvis. The squat sponge is extremely thick and so far has been able to absorb all of the weight I've but on the bar (235lbs). At this point my strength is the only thing limiting the lift. I will try to update as the weight increases.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! And perfect for seated calf raises
customer_reviews.text: Squats w/o cushioning were never a problem for me but now I can do Lunges with no shoulder discomfort! Awesome! And perfect for seated calf raises! Hello!?!?! Why is Squat Sponge not advertising seated calf raise applications!?!?! Towels and other homemade cushions never work! Yeah, okay, so the lady in the pic sold me, but now I am sold on the product :)
customer_reviews.author: cookiedough35

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot. I am 52 yrs old and want to stay in shape so I use it on squats. I don't mind feeling some pain in my legs from the squats, but I'm just too old to not take care of my upper back/shoulders. This does the trick. Wish I had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Great for hip thrusts
customer_reviews.text: Great for hip thrusts, but a little thick for squats--I still use it, but it makes my grip form a little more difficult to maintain. The best use is for protecting the hip bones for hip thrusts and bridges!
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: My review of this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this squat sponge. The velcro bar wrap they use at my fitness center is just too thin and it makes doing leg squats uncomfortable. This thing has been a godsend. I only do squats twice a week but this spong makes them so much more enjoyable and easy to do now. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: NightOwl

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for hip thrusters, not squats. I find that it is too thick for squats, I prefer feeling the bar on my back. It works great for hip thrusters, the bar doesn't kill my pelvic/hip bones and it stays in one place. One of the guys at my gym uses it for squats and he loves it. I lent it to another woman doing weighted glute bridges and she thought it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2agr8boy

customer_reviews.title: Make fun of me all you want!  This helps!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. I use it for squatting and it has helped with the bruising I was getting on my neck. I don't have huge traps like these body builders and the weight was right on my spine I felt and this sponge has allowed me to add more weight to the bar without the neck pain.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god this has changed my Squats for sure. I can use more weight and feel no pain in my traps. I feel more secure when squatting. It is so comfortable. I have been using the skinny sponges at gym, they are awful. I am so glad I invested in this.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: My Glutes say "Thank You!"
customer_reviews.text: If you do barbell glute bridges and/or hip thrusts... this is a must have. Having this sponge has enabled me to put more weight on the bar - which has definitely had an impact on the results I've gotten. Thank you Squat Sponge!! xoxo
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gym accessory
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gym accessory- makes squats much more comfortable and tolerable! Easily slips on the bar and provides a nice thick cushion to the trap area- even if you don't squat with a lot of weight this thing makes it more bearable! Great price for an awesome item that makes a strenuous exercise significantly less arduous.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J.

customer_reviews.title: this pad is great.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second squat sponge. First one lasted a few years and finally wore out. Lasts way longer than the cheaper ones and offers much more comfort and support. Guys in their twenties may not need the cushion, but as you get older or if you have less muscle near the top of your spine, this pad is great.
customer_reviews.author: scott banas

customer_reviews.title: Good for newbies
customer_reviews.text: Good for beginners. Once I started squatting heavier weights (around 200) the damn thing would slip causing the bar to become unstable and slam down on my traps/shoulders. Subsequently I've stopped using it because under larger loads it's not safe.
customer_reviews.author: NoComment

customer_reviews.title: Works Better On Small Bars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two workout buddies and they said it kept slipping off the bar. The both said that it seemed to work better on bars that are smaller than the Olympic bar.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: good padding even after 1.5 years of use
customer_reviews.text: so glad i got this. save my hips in hip-thrusts. padding has held up even after 1.5 year of regular use (thus far)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice padding
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who uses it for barbell hip thrusts. Nice quality, very padded, perfect for the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Good for glute thrusts / bridges
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this for squats - I've always been told not to. However, I am sure it's fine in this application. I use this item for glute thrusts, resting the barbell on by hip bones. This is very painful without a good pad, and this one works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not all There...
customer_reviews.text: The pad is much thicker than others I've tried, but I'm not sure that's a good thing. Several people that have tried it say it's so thick you can't control it. It feels like it wants to roll off your back, or roll onto your neck. Either is dangerous. Also, none of the pictures show that large opening for the bar. It should be a quarter that size. This also requires the pat to be used in exactly the same position every time. Over time, that will flat-spot as all urethanes do. If the opening was smaller, you could rotate it for each use and not cause the flat-spotting.
customer_reviews.author: Ken O.

customer_reviews.title: Works A+++ for hip thrust. I don't use a pad for squat.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this item 5/5 because it works perfect for hip thrust. I don't use it for squating ... just needed padding at the gym for my hips. I've only put on about 165 lbs and it feels really good. No discomfort from bar.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: seems like it's meant for a standard bar not Olympic
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, works well. Minor annoyance is that the pad has to be upside down, seems like it's meant for a standard bar not Olympic. Other than that it does its job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Egge

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know I needed it until I began using it.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know I needed it until I began using it. This squat sponge is very good for neck protection and support, sometimes you don't feel like supporting the weight with nothing but your traps. Only issue I have is once sweat get on it, how are you to thoroughly clean it besides wiping it down.
customer_reviews.author: BEZ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The sponge does not entirely surround the bar. It leaves a large enough gap so that it pops off easily. Such a loose fit leaves it to also spin very easily so you end up with the gapped side instead of the cushion on your shoulders. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dee29

customer_reviews.title: Save the hips!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for barbell hip thrusts, not squats. It's awesome! The shape avoids cutting into my stomach like an exercise mat does, and the thickness protects my hips from bruising. Second only to my wraps, this is one of my best gym purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: great for hip thrusting with heavy weights
customer_reviews.text: I only use this to do my hip thrust. Love it much better than using folded yoga mat around the bar! This sponge is thick enough to soften the weights of the bar on my lower abdomen when I lift it up. Keeps it steadier than my old trick with the yoga mat.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Purchases

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for booty gains!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased! Soft, easy to put on the bars and take off. Quality is good and durable. A must buy if you like some cushion for hip thrusts.
customer_reviews.author: Lilina

customer_reviews.title: Great sponge, I was having a hard time doing ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sponge, I was having a hard time doing squats because of the pain the bar was causing to my neck, now I can do them comfortably. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Camarogirl

customer_reviews.title: User friendly and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: These are so easy to use. Although it is meant for squatting, I use this primarily for glute bridges. I use it at my gym so having your own personal "squat sponge" is sanitary too. It comes off easily since no velcros are involved but stays put while you're working out. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sharr

customer_reviews.title: Neck roll
customer_reviews.text: The opening on the roll is a little wider than expected and doesn't close completely when on the bar so you have to position it just right before you squat. If you can get past that this should be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Roc Bowers

customer_reviews.title: We use it for Barbell Hip bridges at my gym ...
customer_reviews.text: We use it for Barbell Hip bridges at my gym, non of my clients have been tempted to use it for back squats though. but its still being stressed with a lot of weight and many times a day, doesn't deform and protects the clients.
customer_reviews.author: Rances

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am a small frame guy and the squat bar was always pressing on the bone at the top of my spine. I bought 3 different squat products and this one was by far the best. Highly recommend if you have pain or discomfort from the bar sitting on the bone of your spine at the top of your shoulders. This thing is comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Varton

customer_reviews.title: One of the best squat sponges EVER
customer_reviews.text: One of the best squat sponges EVER! So many people in the gym stop me and ask where I purchased the sponge. It is so padded, it allows me to squat even heavier without the bar hurting my neck. LOVE this product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality only issue I have which is minor is that I think the logo should be placed upside down from how it is. When you put this on the bar with the logo the right way the slit is facing down so when you squat heavy the weight of the bar against you causes the pad to slip off. Easy fix just spin the pad so the logo is upside-down
customer_reviews.author: j.Erick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. One small drawback is that it is on thicker side. Slightly difficult to control the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Love the squat sponge
customer_reviews.text: The squat sponge has made lifting heavy much easier on my back. It is soft, durable, and the cut out is perfect so as not to put pressure on the vertebra. It also slips easily on and off the bar to allow fast transition to lifting that does not require padding (arms, etc.). My only suggestion would be to shorten the length of the pad just slightly so that it would not have to be removed at all for other muscle groups. The length requires a wider grip.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Needs a small velcro strap to secure
customer_reviews.text: Really great cushion, the reason why I didn't give it 5 stars it's because I feel it needs a little velcro strap to keep it in place (right in the center) because if it rolls and you are putting pressure on it with your body on the open side, it slips off
customer_reviews.author: V Bon

customer_reviews.title: The squat sponge make them sooooo easy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use for hip thrusts that have been made popular by Bret Contreras, the Glute Guy. The squat sponge make them sooooo easy!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started squatting and every time I couldn't focus b/c the bar was hurting my neck (i'm a petite female so I don't have a lot of meat for cushion). This squat sponge has made a HUGE difference! I can focus and am actually squatting more weight as a result of being able to focus and have support for my neck.
customer_reviews.author: JJ21

customer_reviews.title: It's too thick & bulky
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm too used to the slimmer squat bar protectors, because while I was excited to get this, I've never used it after my first try. It felt too awkward and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: RDP

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: This product works as intended, giving enough needed cushion even when squatting over 200 pounds. The foam is very firm and provides plenty of cushion to save your neck from strain. I especially like the cut out for your neck to rest into. Good product...
customer_reviews.author: Renesis79

customer_reviews.title: Perfect protection from the bar
customer_reviews.text: I kept getting bruises from doing squats. This provides great protection from that. It is a little bulky, but it feels so great. I have also used it for glute bridges to protect my hip bones.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great device for reducing the impact of the bar across your back. Seems much sturdier and, thus, will last longer than those Velcro tube devices I've used and usually wear out in a year or two. PS: Manufacturer told me it will be available in other colors besides red starting next year.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Martins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this for doing squats, doesn't pinch the nerves in my neck like most sponges do
customer_reviews.author: Paul Owens

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have a slightly bulging disc and this thing keeps that hard bar pressure out of the area. Works as described...as other said, it doesnt wrap all the way around an Olympic bar but thats not an issue for me since I'm using a power rack and can adjust it pre-squat
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best Squat and Barbell pad hands down 👍
customer_reviews.text: Best Squat and Barbell pad ever! Great for doing Hip Thrusts too! so Comfortable... it allows me to focus on going hardcore in my workouts without the negative effects that the barbell can do on your body. No more bruising 💪💪💪!
customer_reviews.author: CAROL MEDINA

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions
customer_reviews.text: It makes squatting much more comfortable. I've only had it a few days, so I can't speak for durability though. Goes on and off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Anyone doing heavy squatting needs this sponge, it helps ...
customer_reviews.text: Anyone doing heavy squatting needs this sponge, it helps to protect your neck. Also it can be used when doing weighted hips thrusts with a bar it cushions your hips. Couldn't work out without it.
customer_reviews.author: Michell Chase

customer_reviews.title: The Sponge
customer_reviews.text: The Squat Sponge works better than any other squat pad I have used. It absorbs the weight of the bar and distributes it across your back and takes away the pressure on your shoulders and neck so that you can concentrate on squatting. It doesn't move around or fall off and there is plenty of padding.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morris

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing and it protects my neck bones
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to purchase a squat pad this is the one to purchase. I love this thing and it protects my neck bones. I have had other pad and they did not work nearly as well as this one! Love it! It arrived FAST!
customer_reviews.author: John W. Fannon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I would like it a bit more thicker for such a heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of doing 300+ barbell hip thrust. I would like it a bit more thicker for such a heavy weight but its so much better to use than what the gym offers. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Hip Thrust Must!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Really aids in the comfort while performing hip thrusts!!
customer_reviews.author: pearly

customer_reviews.title: When placed over an olympic bar for doing squats the ...
customer_reviews.text: When placed over an olympic bar for doing squats the gap created (where the slit runs down the pad) is large. This leads to problems when you slide your back under the pad and try to align it. A way to secure the pad, maybe a cover with velcro or velcro straps integrated into the pad would help.
customer_reviews.author: Mizer12

customer_reviews.title: Squats
customer_reviews.text: I carry this sponge in my gym bag, I use it in my gym classes when using weights and when I do free weights at the gym. It works great much better then the old fashioned one I have from years ago with barely any foam.
customer_reviews.author: Harlygrl

customer_reviews.title: Good for Hip Thrusts
customer_reviews.text: Hip thrusts provide a significant challenge to many trainees because they are just really uncomfortable. The squat sponge helps with that. It fits on the bar well enough that it makes getting the bar into place pretty easy and reduces some of the discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Alan Leafman

customer_reviews.title: Worry about your squat, not your sore neck.
customer_reviews.text: I know using this makes me a sissy in the eyes of some lifters but damn it, I can now be concerned about how much weight I'm squatting, not how much my neck hurts. Isn't squatting a lot of weight the point?
customer_reviews.author: Will Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome squat sponge!
customer_reviews.text: -Great invention, helps a lot while squating, protects skin when the bar aggressively hits the neck (specailly when the bar is heavy loaded - or has dents to help grab it) and, most important for me, women loves it! When I go to the gym with mine, every gal asks me to try it! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Marc Valente

customer_reviews.title: To Use ONLY for back squats
customer_reviews.text: For that -- it's perfect. To use it for other padding, well it kind of rolls around out of place on the barbell pole and is too wide to use with Zecher squats and useless for front squats. But for what it's billed for -- and only that -- it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MotherofMany

customer_reviews.title: Good padding
customer_reviews.text: It's great padding. I just don't like when it slips on occasion but other Than that is the best you're gonna get when squating.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie T.

customer_reviews.title: Like it .
customer_reviews.text: I like cuz it is red so it is harder for me to forget it. Works well on most bars but in some it doesn't have wide enough opening.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Garduno

customer_reviews.title: No hip pain and very easy and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I started using this for hip thrusts and it gets the job done. No hip pain and very easy and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Denver L Martin

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: . . . it is branded in large letters - "Squat" "Sponge" - on both sides, which makes it super cheesy looking and kind of embarrassing to take to Body Pump. There's no way to turn it to be more discreet.
customer_reviews.author: destroying angel

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: If you don't barbell thrusters this is a must have. Works great and no hip pain.
customer_reviews.author: S.spencer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else like it available anywhere to my knowledge
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else like it available anywhere to my knowledge. If you do hip thrusters -- with the barbell across your hips -- you need a very thick pad. THIS is the pad you want. A little too bulky for squats for me though.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick. Helped out with my neck hurting during my body pump class.
customer_reviews.author: luvlakerz

customer_reviews.title: Best Sponge Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: this is the best bar sponger ever made. I have issues with my spine and when I use this sponge it feels like nothing is on my shoulders . I totally recommend this product to anyone who squats any weight
customer_reviews.author: Silky Santana

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: I really only got this because the girl advertising it has a really great behind. However, this thing works wonders...well for the last month anyway. Will update if it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: So close....
customer_reviews.text: It's tremendous idea that almost hit the bullseye. Sadly, as you can tell from my pictures, the issue is with the product not completely and tightly fitting around the bar. I have some Fat Gripz that are also pictured. If the Squat Sponge fit like the Fat Gripz it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: michael d. eckard

customer_reviews.title: nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: this does what it is supposed to. it helps keep the bar from hurting your back. I would not say its any better than the $10 one you saw on the search results right next to it.
customer_reviews.author: TTS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and thickness
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and thickness. Perfect for lunges, squats and pelvic thrusts. Been using it for a while, still works and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: BossyLady

customer_reviews.title: couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, and he loves it. It's long enough for him to also use when he rests the bar on his knees while sitting to do some calf raises. It fits the bar nicely, while also being easy to put on and take off with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Anna C.

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder Saver
customer_reviews.text: We have tried several popular varieties of devices to protect the shoulders and traps when doing squats. This sponge is by far the best. This is our second one and it appears to be more durable than the first.
customer_reviews.author: Big Kaufer

customer_reviews.title: Must-have
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for squats. Zero neck pain. Ditch your old models!!
customer_reviews.author: Kris M.

product_meta.title: Squat Sponge Red 18"long, 3.5” diameter & 1.25"thick Olympic Barbell Pad
product_meta.description: Squat Sponge 18"long, 3.5" diameter & 1.25"thick Olympic Barbell Pad. enhances and allows for proper form for squats and lunges and provides additional comfort for the upper and lower back and abdomen area during said exercises for supporting a barbell. For a limited time only Giving away a Free consultation with an credited personal trainer like Elise Firestone, This is $75 dollar value. For a limited time only with each Squat Sponge purchase.
feature_bullets: allows for proper form of squats and lunges w/comfort for the upper and lower back and abdomen area sock absorbing low-density foam for cradling the spine
Molded thick foam of varying degrees of open and close cell foam; thickness and density with a grooved channel in the center it is18” long, 3.5”diameter &1.25” thick that will cradling the spine.
Squat Sponge Barbell Cushion Pad has been designed by a guy who loves to do Squats. For more information please look up our website under squat sponge.
Squat Sponge the advanced barbell pad.
